intro: Eremostachys mogianica, commonly known as the Mogiana eremostachys, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, rocky environments. Eremostachys mogianica is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
